date: stated on July 9, 2019 in a Facebook post:
title: Okasio Cortez didn't say she was talking to herself because she had a "very good mind." That was Trump.
text: The U.S. Republic of Alexandria Okasio Cortez is not a stranger to fake memes on the Internet. Most claimed that she said things she didn't say, and one depressed her financial stability, and another arranged a picture to make her look like she was in a bargaining position. And now we have another interesting quote that was falsely attributed to democracy in New York on Facebook. The article depicts a picture of Okasio Cortez and quotes him: "I'm talking to myself, the first, because I have a very good mind and I have said a lot of things - Alexandria Okasio Cortez on foreign policy." The 9th article of July was announced as part of Facebook's efforts to combat false news and misleading information in its broadcast. ∙ (Read more about our partnership with Facebook.) On January 12, 2021, he wrote in an Instagram article saying that Joe Biden remained silent about the violence in Black Lives-Mite protests. By Tom Kircher: January 16, 2021, unfortunately, you didn't say - Donald Trump did. On March 16, 2016, Trump participated, and the Republican candidate - the candidate - was then identified as a telephone interview in the MSNBC News "Am Joe." The co-speaker Mika Barzzinsky begins by asking Trump who he is consulting on foreign policy issues. Trump answers with the exact phrase: "I'm talking to myself, number one, because I have a very good mind and I've said a lot of things." And he keeps talking about how he wrote about Osama bin Laden before September 11, that he knows what he's doing and he listens and talks to "a lot of people... but my principal advisor is myself." This quote goes back to Trump, not Okasio Cortez. We value this me pants on fire!
